OrgName: Monster Worldwide, Inc., and its subsidiary, Monster Worldwide Technologies, LLC
activities:
Monster collects personal information from job seekers to help them locate and apply to jobs and to network with friends and colleagues. This data includes resume information, cover letters, and any networking information seekers choose to provide. 

Monster collects business contact information from employers to provide them with Monster accounts where they can post job openings or search the resume database to locate candidates. 

Monster collects human resources information from Monster associates and employees in the EU and Switzerland.
contacttitle1: Executive Vice President and Chief Privacy Officer
corpofftitle1: Executive Vice President and Chief Privacy Officer
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Slovakia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Resume/CV data, cover letters, and profile data from job seekers; business contact information from employers; and human resources data about Monster employees.
recoursemech:
With respect to human resources data only, the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) will be Monster Worldwide, Inc.'s and Monster Technologies, LLC's independent dispute resolution recourse mechanism and with respect to Human Resources data only in Switzerland, Monster will cooperate with the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)

For all other data, TRUSTe is Monster Worldwide, Inc.'s, and Monster Technologies, LLC's third party dispute resolution mechanism.
